PROTEIN NAME: ATP synthase subunit alpha (EC 3.6.3.14) (ATP synthase F1 sector subunit alpha) (F-ATPase subunit alpha) (Vegetative protein 100) (VEG100)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: F-type ATPases have 2 components, CF(1) - the catalytic core - and CF(0) - the membrane proton channel. CF(1) has five subunits: alpha(3), beta(3), gamma(1), delta(1), epsilon(1). CF(0) has three main subunits: a(1), b(2) and c(9-12). The alpha and beta chains form an alternating ring which encloses part of the gamma chain. CF(1) is attached to CF(0) by a central stalk formed by the gamma and epsilon chains, while a peripheral stalk is formed by the delta and b chains (Probable). The F(1)F(0) complex interacts with SpoIIIJ and YqjG; YqgA is found in the same complex. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_01346, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19717609, ECO:0000305}.

PROTEIN NAME: 2-oxoisovalerate dehydrogenase subunit beta (EC 1.2.4.4) (Branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase E1 component beta chain) (BCKDH E1-beta)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of two alpha and two beta chains. Directly associated with ODBA in the E1 complex.

PROTEIN NAME: 2-oxoisovalerate dehydrogenase subunit alpha (EC 1.2.4.4) (Branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase E1 component alpha chain) (BCKDH E1-alpha)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of two alpha and two beta chains. Directly associated with ODBB in the E1 complex.

PROTEIN NAME: Lipoamide acyltransferase component of branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase complex (EC 2.3.1.168) (Branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase complex component E2) (BCKAD-E2) (BCKADE2) (Dihydrolipoamide acetyltransferase component of branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase complex) (Dihydrolipoamide branched chain transacylase) (Dihydrolipoyllysine-residue (2-methylpropanoyl)transferase)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Forms a 24-polypeptide structural core with octahedral symmetry.

PROTEIN NAME: Ribose import permease protein RbsC
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of an ATP-binding protein (RbsA), two transmembrane proteins (RbsC) and a solute-binding protein (RbsB). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P0AGI1}.

PROTEIN NAME: Acetyl-coenzyme A carboxylase carboxyl transferase subunit beta (ACCase subunit beta) (Acetyl-CoA carboxylase carboxyltransferase subunit beta) (EC 6.4.1.2)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Acetyl-CoA carboxylase is a heterohexamer composed of biotin carboxyl carrier protein (AccB), biotin carboxylase (AccC) and two subunits each of ACCase subunit alpha (AccA) and ACCase subunit beta (AccD). {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_01395}.

PROTEIN NAME: Isopentenyl-diphosphate delta-isomerase (IPP isomerase) (EC 5.3.3.2) (Isopentenyl diphosphate:dimethylallyl diphosphate isomerase) (Isopentenyl pyrophosphate isomerase) (Type 2 isopentenyl diphosphate isomerase) (IDI-2)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Homooctamer. Dimer of tetramers. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_00354, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12798687}.

PROTEIN NAME: ATP synthase subunit b (ATP synthase F(0) sector subunit b) (ATPase subunit I) (F-type ATPase subunit b) (F-ATPase subunit b)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: F-type ATPases have 2 components, F(1) - the catalytic core - and F(0) - the membrane proton channel. F(1) has five subunits: alpha(3), beta(3), gamma(1), delta(1), epsilon(1). F(0) has three main subunits: a(1), b(2) and c(10-14). The alpha and beta chains form an alternating ring which encloses part of the gamma chain. F(1) is attached to F(0) by a central stalk formed by the gamma and epsilon chains, while a peripheral stalk is formed by the delta and b chains (Probable). The F(1)F(0) complex interacts with SpoIIIJ and YqjG; YqgA is found in the same complex. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_01398, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19717609, ECO:0000305}.

PROTEIN NAME: Succinate--CoA ligase [ADP-forming] subunit alpha (EC 6.2.1.5) (Succinyl-CoA synthetase subunit alpha) (SCS-alpha)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of two alpha and two beta subunits. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_01988}.

PROTEIN NAME: Fe(3+)-citrate import ATP-binding protein YfmF (Ferric-citrate import ATP-binding protein) (EC 3.6.3.-)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of one ATP-binding protein (YfmF), two transmembrane proteins (YfmD and YfmE) and a solute-binding protein (YfmC). {ECO:0000305}.

PROTEIN NAME: Acetyl-coenzyme A carboxylase carboxyl transferase subunit alpha (ACCase subunit alpha) (Acetyl-CoA carboxylase carboxyltransferase subunit alpha) (EC 6.4.1.2)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Acetyl-CoA carboxylase is a heterohexamer composed of biotin carboxyl carrier protein (AccB), biotin carboxylase (AccC) and two subunits each of ACCase subunit alpha (AccA) and ACCase subunit beta (AccD). {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_00823}.

PROTEIN NAME: Phenylalanine--tRNA ligase alpha subunit (EC 6.1.1.20) (Phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase alpha subunit) (PheRS)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Tetramer of two alpha and two beta subunits. {ECO:0000250}.

PROTEIN NAME: ATP phosphoribosyltransferase (ATP-PRT) (ATP-PRTase) (EC 2.4.2.17)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Heteromultimer composed of HisG and HisZ subunits. {ECO:0000250}.

PROTEIN NAME: Teichoic acids export ATP-binding protein TagH (EC 3.6.3.40) (Teichoic acid-transporting ATPase)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (TagH) and two transmembrane proteins (TagG). {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_01715}.

PROTEIN NAME: Heme A synthase (HAS) (EC 1.3.-.-) (Cytochrome aa3-controlling protein)

UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Tetramer of 2 alpha and 2 beta subunits. {ECO:0000250}.

PROTEIN NAME: Carbamoyl-phosphate synthase arginine-specific small chain (EC 6.3.5.5) (Carbamoyl-phosphate synthetase glutamine chain)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Composed of two chains; the small (or glutamine) chain promotes the hydrolysis of glutamine to ammonia, which is used by the large (or ammonia) chain to synthesize carbamoyl phosphate.

PROTEIN NAME: Urease subunit gamma (EC 3.5.1.5) (Urea amidohydrolase subunit gamma)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Heterotrimer of UreA (gamma), UreB (beta) and UreC (alpha) subunits. Three heterotrimers associate to form the active enzyme. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_00739}.

PROTEIN NAME: Glycine--tRNA ligase alpha subunit (EC 6.1.1.14) (Glycyl-tRNA synthetase alpha subunit) (GlyRS)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Tetramer of two alpha and two beta subunits.

PROTEIN NAME: Glycine--tRNA ligase beta subunit (EC 6.1.1.14) (Glycyl-tRNA synthetase beta subunit) (GlyRS)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Tetramer of two alpha and two beta subunits.

PROTEIN NAME: Probable siderophore transport system ATP-binding protein YusV
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The iron-hydroxamate siderophore complex is composed of one ATP-binding protein (YusV), two transmembrane proteins (YfiZ and YfhA) and a solute-binding protein (YfiY); the catechoplate siderophore complex is composed of one ATP-binding protein (YusV), two transmembrane proteins (FeuB and FeuC) and a solute-binding protein (FeuA). {ECO:0000305}.

PROTEIN NAME: Carbamoyl-phosphate synthase arginine-specific large chain (EC 6.3.5.5) (Carbamoyl-phosphate synthetase ammonia chain)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Composed of two chains; the small (or glutamine) chain promotes the hydrolysis of glutamine to ammonia, which is used by the large (or ammonia) chain to synthesize carbamoyl phosphate.

PROTEIN NAME: L-cystine-binding protein TcyK
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (TcyN), two transmembrane proteins (TcyL and TcyM) and two solute-binding proteins (TcyJ and TcyK). {ECO:0000305}.

UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Forms a 24-polypeptide structural core with octahedral symmetry.

PROTEIN NAME: S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase proenzyme (AdoMetDC) (SAMDC) (EC 4.1.1.50) [Cleaved into: S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase beta chain; S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase alpha chain]

PROTEIN NAME: Sulfite reductase [NADPH] hemoprotein beta-component (SiR-HP) (SiRHP) (EC 1.8.1.2)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Alpha(8)-beta(8). The alpha component is a flavoprotein, the beta component is a hemoprotein (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

PROTEIN NAME: High-affinity zinc uptake system binding-protein ZnuA
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (ZnuC), two transmembrane proteins (ZnuB) and a solute-binding protein (ZnuA). {ECO:0000305}.

UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Tetramer of two alpha and two beta subunits. {ECO:0000250}.

PROTEIN NAME: Sulfite reductase [NADPH] flavoprotein alpha-component (SiR-FP) (EC 1.8.1.2)

PROTEIN NAME: Teichoic acid translocation permease protein TagG
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (TagH) and two transmembrane proteins (TagG). {ECO:0000305}.

PROTEIN NAME: Ribonuclease P protein component (RNase P protein) (RNaseP protein) (EC 3.1.26.5) (Protein C5)
UNIPROT NOTE: SUBUNIT: Consists of a catalytic RNA component (M1 or rnpB) and a protein subunit. Might be a component of the prossible RNA degradosome complex composed of rny, rnjA, rnjB, pnp, pfkA and eno, and possibly also rnpA. Interacts with RNA helicase CshA. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_00227, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21764917}.

PROTEIN NAME: S-adenosylmethionine synthase (AdoMet synthase) (EC 2.5.1.6) (MAT) (Methionine adenosyltransferase)
